intro: Tithymalus prunifolius, commonly known as the cherry-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley, carrots, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, spicy scent. Tithymalus prunifolius is often found in woodland edges and moist meadows, where it thrives in partial shade.
